text: hi guys today it's sweet potato day and
guess what I'm making sweet potato
casserole complete with marshmallows
everything I know you like it don't even
pretend that you don't it is a perennial
favorite so I'm gonna show you how to
make it I'm starting with three pounds
of sweet potatoes they need to be peeled
cut them into like 1 and 1/2 inch chunks
approximately it's not super important
what size they are you just want them to
be about the same size you don't want
them too too small because then they
would probably absorb too much water so
this is a pretty big recipe because it's
designed for the holidays 3 pounds of
sweet potatoes is a lot if you're making
this at other times of year and you're
only feeding a smaller family you could
probably cut it in half and use a pound
and a half ok get them into a pot you're
gonna want to have them covered by about
one inch with cold water then bring them
to a boil and turn it on and then they
take about 15 minutes to simmer until
they're tender once they come to a boil
don't forget to season them we want to
season them before you start cooking
them so it absorbs the flavors to put
some salt in your pot I usually add like
a tablespoon of salt for a big amount of
water so that it has plenty of salt to
make the water salty enough that it
actually flavors the food so about 15 20
minutes until those are tender then
you're gonna drain them so when these
are done they should be tender enough to
mash and these look good give them a
drain
and then put them back in the pot and
then what you want to do is just dry
them out just so they're not too wet do
this with regular mashed potatoes - you
cook off some of the moisture and that
allows you to add moisture to that
without it getting soggy and wet what
you're looking for is a little bit of a
film on the bottom of the pot and that's
starting to happen so I'm ready to add
the remainder of my ingredients it's 1/2
a cup of whole milk four tablespoons of
unsalted butter a little bit of nutmeg
up to a half a teaspoon I think I'm
gonna do like 1/8 to 1/4 of a teaspoon
though I find it a little overwhelming
but some people really love that intense
nutmeg flavor
give it some salt and pepper and then
mash
[Applause]
yeah oh my gosh
delicious last year I made a mash with
sweet potatoes and cauliflower it's half
sweet potatoes and half cauliflower and
it was so good you guys amazing I know a
lot of people do that because they're
trying to cut down on calories and they
replace more fattening things with
cauliflower but that wasn't my intention
but it was so delicious you barely
needed any butter and I am not shy about
butter you guys know that but if you're
the kind of person that is it's a really
really cool thing to do into your baking
dish the oven should be preheated to 375
degrees obviously this is hot so you're
really only going to look to melt your
marshmallows but you can make this ahead
so you can make it ahead up to this
point and refrigerate it and then put
the marshmallows on and finish it off
and then it would take a little longer
to reheat but it's a great make-ahead
side dish for the holidays smooth them
out so they're even doesn't really
matter you're gonna cover this now with
yeah that's right marshmallows mini
marshmallows you can use whole
marshmallow big marshmallows and cut
them in half if you want to so get this
in the oven until it's heated through
and the marshmallows are golden brown
now that'll take 15 to 20 minutes if
your potatoes are caught but if they're
hot probably a little bit less it's done
if you want even more broiler enos or
you want a little bit of brightness on
top you can put it under the broiler for
a few seconds but this is straight out
of the oven I'm getting excited already
and I haven't even tasted it yet
mmm I'm double dipping oh my gosh ah
mazing this is so good that if you make
it for your family for Thanksgiving
they're gonna love you forever I mean I
know they already love you but they're
gonna love you extra a lot this year
